articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Organization of American States (OAS) on Saturday named the representatives that will lead its mission to mediate between Guatemalan officials and street protesters seeking an orderly transfer to power to President-elect Bernardo Arevalo, according to a statement published on social media site X.
articles.title: OAS names mediators for Guatemala conflict that threatens transfer of power

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain's opposition Labour Party is on course to win a landslide victory at a national election expected next year, according to an opinion poll published on Saturday.
articles.title: UK's opposition Labour on course for landslide election victory, poll predicts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indian rescue teams are finding it difficult to reach flood-hit areas in the north-eastern state of Sikkim where more than 140 people are missing because the region is still experiencing bouts of heavy rain, officials said on Saturday.
articles.title: Indian rescuers struggle to reach flood-hit areas where over 140 are missing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's defence ministry said the country's air defence systems had "detected and destroyed" two Ukrainian S-200 anti-aircraft missiles, thwarting attacks it said Kyiv attempted four hours apart on the Crimean Peninsula on Saturday.
articles.title: Russia says it shoots down two missiles over Crimea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A party official in the Russian-held town of Nova Kakhovka in Ukraine's Kherson province was killed by a car bomb on Saturday, the provincial governor said.
articles.title: Car bomb kills official in Russian-held Ukrainian town, governor says

articles.author: Chen Lin
articles.description: Singapore's air quality fell into the unhealthy range on Saturday, official readings showed, as increased forest fires from neighbouring Indonesia brought haze to the city-state.
articles.title: Haze hits Singapore as hot spots in Indonesia's Sumatra increase

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former Madagascar president Marc Ravalomanana said he had sustained a leg injury on Saturday when police and soldiers fired teargas to disperse a gathering of his supporters and those of other candidates challenging the incumbent president.
articles.title: Madagascar presidential candidate shows injury after opposition rally teargassed

articles.author: Emily Rose
articles.description: As Israel reeled from a deadly attack by Hamas militants who broke through barriers around Gaza and roamed at will, killing scores of civilians in Israeli towns, defence chiefs faced growing questions over how the disaster could have happened.
articles.title: Israel's security forces face questions after Hamas attack lays bare intelligence gaps

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: California Governor Gavin Newsom on Saturday vetoed a bill passed recently by the state legislature to explicitly ban caste discrimination, citing existing laws that already prohibit ancestry discrimination, which made the bill "unnecessary."
articles.title: California governor vetoes bill to ban caste discrimination

articles.author: Lauren Silva Laughlin
articles.description: Serial swipers on Tinder are going to pay for that dopamine rush. The dating app owned by Match (MTCH.O) said last week it’s rolling out a subscription tier called “Tinder Select” that will cost $500 a month. The $12 billion company could make even more money if it approached hookups the way computer games hook users.
articles.title: Dating apps can embrace gamification of hookups
